intro: Lavatera thirkeana, commonly known as the New Zealand flax or kōwhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has soft, hairy leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in coastal and forested areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Lavatera thirkeana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has cultural significance among Māori people.
